solution_line_template: Removing the surplus hairspray shows the salon needs {total_cans_bought_daily} total cans of hairspray - {surplus_cans_daily} surplus cans of hairspray = <<{total_cans_bought_daily}-{surplus_cans_daily}={cans_for_customers_daily}>>{cans_for_customers_daily} cans of hairspray for each customer.

Each customer needs {cans_for_styling_per_customer} can of hairspray for styling + {cans_to_take_home_per_customer} can of hairspray to take home = <<{cans_for_styling_per_customer}+{cans_to_take_home_per_customer}={total_cans_per_customer}>>{total_cans_per_customer} cans of hairspray.

So the salon has a total of {cans_for_customers_daily} cans of hairspray / {total_cans_per_customer} cans of hairspray per customer = <<{cans_for_customers_daily}/{total_cans_per_customer}={num_customers_daily}>>{num_customers_daily} customers.
